channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox on edge of road, 10th July
item.description:
It has been there since this morning. I reported it and then was told it was fixed but itâ€™s still there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of multiple bags of rubbish, 10th July
item.description:
Bags of rubbish are being left on the street. They are scattered along Lannoy Road and Gaitskell Road. I thought they may have been left by a street sweeper but some have been there over a week. I took some bags that were left outside my house to the dump a while back, but more have appeared. The longer they're left, the more rubbish is being added.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Reventlow Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking Restriction Sign Post Knocked - Lambton Road N19, 10th July
item.description:
The sign post displaying parking restrictions appears to have been hit and is now leaning over and unstable. Post is situated between 55 - 61 Lambton Road. Photo provided.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Lambton Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocking pavement, 10th July
item.description:
Hedge outside 2 Ivanhoe Road has not been cut for as long as I can remember. Pavement is now completely blocked and cars are having to park further into the road (outside the designated spaces) as a consequence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Ivanhoe Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping build up at Norman Court, 10th July
item.description:
Steady build up of people using the Courtyard as a fly tipping zone. Almost every day this is building up, and no item has a note for large delivery collection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ugly moronic graffiti, 10th July
item.description:
The beautiful London brick wall belonging to Surrey House in Shardeloes Road has three new ugly pieces of graffiti, which need to be removed before this antisocial habit spreads. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Chestnut Close, New Cross, London

item.title: Fly tipping everyday in the same point, 10th July
item.description:
These fly tipping of chairs and wood were dumped today! The area need more under surveillance someone that lives around must be doing this as they know exactly very well the area! Lot of vans also park king on the same street everyday !! This is absolutely unacceptable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Hither Farm Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned and Damaged Lime Bikes at Orpington, 10th July
item.description:
Dear Lime Support Team, I would like to report two abandoned Lime bikes that have been badly damaged. Both bikes have had their wheels removed and have been left discarded on a patch of grass near the following location: 14 Beddington Road, Orpington, BR5 2TG I have marked the exact location on Google Maps for your reference, and have also taken photos of the damaged and abandoned bikes. Kind regards, Linda

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abbotts Walk is littered with potholes from end to end., 10th July
item.description:
The whole of Abbotts Walk has many potholes and a very uneven surface. I reported this sometime ago under reference 7491236 and have never heard anything back from the council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbott's Walk, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dead birds on top of substation, 10th July
item.description:
There are at least 2 dead pigeons on top of the sub station (could be 3). It is unclear how they got there, maybe foxes but I worry they will smell and decompose in the heat, and may attract vermin. This is on The Avenue where people and children walk constantly it's unhygienic and needs to be dealt with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
